Article.Abstract: Protein conformation during intracellular routing and translocation of the ribosome-inactivating proteins was investigated on hybridomas producing monoclonal antibodies (monAbs) against mistletoe lectin (ML). Decrease in the toxin activity towards these hybridomas is accounted for by the intracellular interaction of monAbs and the toxin resulting in the interruption of enzymatic subunit translocation into the cytosol. Obtained monAbs interacted with denatured ML A-chain (MLA) and a panel of MLA synthetic octapeptides linked to the surface of polyethylene pins. Enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) shows that monAbs recognize five epitopes in denatured MLA. Treatment of MLA by 3 M of guanidine hydrochloride leads to appearance of the epitopes. Hybridoma TA7 has been shown to be insensitive to cytotoxic action of ML. TA7 monAb as we have shown recognizes epitope 101-105, FTGTT, and inhibits the liposome aggregation induced by MLA. A study of the cytotoxicity of ML and ricin for the hybridomas revealed that the unfolding of A-chain is probably required for intracellular transport and cytotoxic activity of ML.
Article.ArticleTitle: Mistletoe lectin A-chain unfolds during the intracellular transport.
Article.Affiliations: State Research Institute of Genetics and Selection of Industrial Microorganisms, 1st Dorozhnyi pr. 1, 113545, Moscow, Russia.
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Animals; Antibodies, Monoclonal(immunology); Cells, Cultured; Cytosol(metabolism); Dose-Response Relationship, Drug; Enzyme-Linked Immunosorbent Assay; Epitope Mapping; Epitopes(immunology); Guanidine(pharmacology); Hybridomas(immunology); Inhibitory Concentration 50; Lectins(chemistry; immunology); Liposomes(metabolism); Mice; Mice, Inbred BALB C; Mistletoe(chemistry; immunology); Plant Lectins; Plants, Medicinal; Protein Conformation; Protein Folding; Ricin(pharmacology)

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Genbank entry is for prepromistletoe lectin and epitope position is then different.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization is performed with subunit A of source protein (MLA).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Polyclonal serum interaction with this peptide is weak (0.05-1 OD range).

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization is performed with subunit A of source protein (MLA). Hybridoma production was performed fusing immune spleens with sp2/0 murine myeloma cells.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Monoclonal antibodies TA72 and TA73 interaction with this region is strong (1-3 OD range), while TA76, TA75 and TA71 interaction is weak (0.05-1 OD range).

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Epitope sequence defined by similar reactivity against 7-aa- overlapping octamer peptides containing this sequence. Genbank entry is for prepromistletoe lectin and epitope position is then different.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization is performed with subunit A of source protein (MLA). Hybridoma production was performed fusing immune spleens with sp2/0 murine myeloma cells.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Monoclonal antibody TA7 interaction with this region is strong (1-3 OD range). This corresponds to a partly exposed region on the protein surface. The mAb is able to confer toxin resistance to the hybridoma producing it, to inhibit toxin mediated liposome fusion and recognize non-native, partially unfolded MLA, leading the authors to conclude that MLA is unfolded during intracellular transport.
